   20: -module(init_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([get_arguments/1, get_argument/1, boot_var/1, restart/1,
   29: 	 many_restarts/0, many_restarts/1, restart_with_mode/1,
   30: 	 get_plain_arguments/1,
   31: 	 reboot/1, stop_status/1, stop/1, get_status/1, script_id/1,
   32:          dot_erlang/1, unknown_module/1, dash_S/1, dash_extra/1,
   33:          dash_run/1, dash_s/1,
   34: 	 find_system_processes/0
   35:          ]).
   36: -export([boot1/1, boot2/1]).
   37: -export([test_dash_S/1, test_dash_s/1, test_dash_extra/0,
   38:          test_dash_run/0, test_dash_run/1]).
   39: 
   40: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   41: 
   42: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   43: %% Test suite for init. (Most code is run during system start/stop.
   44: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
   45: %% erl -sname master -rsh ctrsh
   46: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [get_arguments, get_argument, boot_var,
   53:      many_restarts, restart_with_mode,
   54:      get_plain_arguments, restart, stop_status, get_status, script_id,
   55:      dot_erlang, unknown_module, {group, boot},
   56:      dash_S, dash_extra, dash_run, dash_s].
   57: 
   58: groups() -> 
   59:     [{boot, [], [boot1, boot2]}].
   60: 
   61: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   65:     ok.
   66: 
   67: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: 
   74: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   75:     Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: get_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   81:     Args = args(),
   82:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
   83:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_arguments, []) of
   84: 	Arguments when is_list(Arguments) ->
   85: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
   86: 	    check_a(Arguments),
   87: 	    check_b(Arguments),
   88: 	    check_c(Arguments),
   89: 	    check_d(Arguments);
   90: 	_ ->
   91:             peer:stop(Peer),
   92: 	    ct:fail(get_arguments)
   93:     end,
   94:     ok.
   95: 
   96: check_a(Args) ->
   97:     case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args) of
   98: 	{value, {a,["kalle"]}} ->
   99: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(a,1,Args),
  100: 	    case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args1) of
  101: 		false ->
  102: 		    ok;
  103: 		_ ->
  104: 		    ct:fail(check_a1)
  105: 	    end;
  106: 	_ ->
  107: 	    ct:fail(check_a2)
  108:     end.
  109: 
  110: check_b(Args) ->
  111:     case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args) of
  112: 	{value, {b,["hej", "hopp"]}} ->
  113: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args),
  114: 	    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args1) of
  115: 		{value, {b,["san", "sa"]}} ->
  116: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args1),
  117: 		    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args2) of
  118: 			false ->
  119: 			    ok;
  120: 			_ ->
  121: 			    ct:fail(check_b1)
  122: 		    end;
  123: 		_ ->
  124: 		    ct:fail(check_b2)
  125: 	    end;
  126: 	_ ->
  127: 	    ct:fail(check_b3)
  128:     end.
  129: 
  130: check_c(Args) ->
  131:     case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args) of
  132: 	{value, {c,["4", "5", "6"]}} ->
  133: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args),
  134: 	    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args1) of
  135: 		{value, {c,["7", "8", "9"]}} ->
  136: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args1),
  137: 		    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args2) of
  138: 			false ->
  139: 			    ok;
  140: 			_ ->
  141: 			    ct:fail(check_c1)
  142: 		    end;
  143: 		_ ->
  144: 		    ct:fail(check_c2)
  145: 	    end;
  146: 	_ ->
  147: 	    ct:fail(check_c3)
  148:     end.
  149: 
  150: check_d(Args) ->
  151:     case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args) of
  152: 	{value, {d,[]}} ->
  153: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(d,1,Args),
  154: 	    case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args1) of
  155: 		false ->
  156: 		    ok;
  157: 		_ ->
  158: 		    ct:fail(check_d1)
  159: 	    end;
  160: 	_ ->
  161: 	    ct:fail(check_d2)
  162:     end.
  163: 
  164: get_argument(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  165:     Args = args(),
  166:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  167:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [b]) of
  168: 	{ok, [["hej", "hopp"],["san", "sa"]]} ->
  169: 	    ok;
  170: 	_ ->
  171: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  172: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, b})
  173:     end,
  174:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [a]) of
  175: 	{ok, [["kalle"]]} ->
  176: 	    ok;
  177: 	_ ->
  178: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  179: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, a})
  180:     end,
  181:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  182: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  183: 	    ok;
  184: 	_ ->
  185: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  186: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, c})
  187:     end,
  188:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [d]) of
  189: 	{ok, [[]]} ->
  190: 	    ok;
  191: 	_ ->
  192: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  193: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, d})
  194:     end,
  195:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [e]) of
  196: 	error ->
  197: 	    ok;
  198: 	_ ->
  199: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  200: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, e})
  201:     end,
  202:     peer:stop(Peer),
  203:     ok.
  204: 
  205: get_plain_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  206:     Longstring = 
  207: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  208: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  209: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  210: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  211: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  212: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  213: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  214: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  215: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2",
  216:     true = (length(Longstring) > 255),
  217:     Args = long_args(Longstring),
  218:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  219:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_plain_arguments, []) of
  220: 	["a", "b", "c", Longstring] ->
  221: 	    ok;
  222: 	As ->
  223: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  224: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, As})
  225:     end,
  226:     peer:stop(Peer),
  227: 
  228:     ok.
  229: 
  230: 
  231: %% ------------------------------------------------
  232: %% Use -boot_var flag to set $TEST_VAR in boot script.
  233: %% ------------------------------------------------
  234: boot_var(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  235:     {BootScript, TEST_VAR, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} = create_boot(Config),
  236: 
  237:     %% Should fail as we have not given -boot_var TEST_VAR
  238:     try
  239:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-boot", BootScript], connection => standard_io}),
  240:         ct:fail({boot_var, "Should not start without TEST_VAR"})
  241:     catch
  242:         exit:{boot_failed,{exit_status,1}} ->
  243:             ok
  244:     end,
  245: 
  246: 
  247:     case is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) of
  248: 	true ->
  249: 	    %% Now it should work !!
  250: 	    {ok, Peer, _} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootScript, "-boot_var", "TEST_VAR", TEST_VAR]),
  251: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  252: 	    Res = ok;
  253: 	_ ->
  254: 	    %% What we need is not so much version numbers on the directories, but
  255: 	    %% for the boot var TEST_VAR to appear in the boot script, and it doesn't
  256: 	    %% if we give the 'local' option to systools:make_script.
  257: 	    io:format(
  258: 	      "Test case not complete as we are not~n"
  259: 	      "running in a real system!~n"
  260: 	      "Probably this test is performed in a "
  261: 	      "clearcase view or source tree.~n"
  262: 	      "Need version numbers on the kernel and "
  263: 	      "stdlib directories!~n",
  264: 	      []),
  265: 	    Res = {skip,
  266: 		   "Test case only partially run since it is run "
  267: 		   "in a clearcase view or in a source tree. "
  268: 		   "Need an installed system to complete this test."}
  269:     end,
  270:     Res.
  271: 
  272: create_boot(Config) ->
  273:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  274:     {LatestDir, LatestName, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} =
  275: 	create_script(Config),
  276:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  277:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
  278:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName,
  279: 			      [{variables, [{"TEST_VAR", LibDir}]}]),
  280:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
  281:     {LatestDir ++ "/" ++ LatestName, LibDir, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn}.
  282: 
  283: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
  284:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  285:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "kernel-"++KernelVsn)) andalso
  286: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "stdlib-"++StdlibVsn)).
  287: 
  288: %% ------------------------------------------------
  289: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  290: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  291: %% before restart.
  292: %% ------------------------------------------------
  293: many_restarts() ->
  294:     [{timetrap,{minutes,16}}].
  295: 
  296: many_restarts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  297:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io}),
  298:     loop_restart(50,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])),
  299:     peer:stop(Peer),
  300:     ok.
  301: 
  302: loop_restart(0,_,_,_) ->
  303:     ok;
  304: loop_restart(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  305:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  306:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  307:     receive
  308: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  309: 	    ok
  310:     after 10000 ->
  311: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  312: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  313:     end,
  314:     ok = wait_for(60, Peer, Node, EHPid),
  315:     loop_restart(N-1,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])).
  316: 
  317: wait_for(0,Peer,_Node,_) ->
  318:     peer:stop(Peer),
  319:     error;
  320: wait_for(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  321:     case rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [logger]) of
  322: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid), Pid =/= EHPid ->
  323: 	    %% erlang:display(ok),
  324: 	    ok;
  325: 	_X ->
  326: 	    %% erlang:display(_X),
  327: 	    %% Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  328: 	    %% erlang:display(Procs),
  329: 	    %% case is_list(Procs) of
  330: 	    %%     true ->
  331: 	    %% 	  [(catch erlang:display(
  332: 	    %% 			  rpc:call(Node,
  333: 	    %% 				   erlang,
  334: 	    %% 				   process_info,
  335: 	    %% 				   [Y,registered_name])))
  336: 	    %% 		 || Y <- Procs];
  337: 	    %%     _ ->
  338: 	    %% 	  ok
  339: 	    %% end,
  340: 	    receive
  341: 	    after 100 ->
  342: 		    ok
  343: 	    end,
  344: 	    wait_for(N-1,Peer,Node,EHPid)
  345:     end.
  346: 
  347: restart_with_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  348:     %% We cannot use loose_node because it doesn't run in
  349:     %% embedded mode so we quickly start one that exits after restarting
  350:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  351: 
  352:     Quote = case os:type() of
  353:                 {win32,_} ->
  354:                     [$"];
  355:                 {unix,_} ->
  356:                     [$']
  357:             end,
  358: 
  359:     Eval1 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of interactive -> init:restart([{mode,embedded}]); embedded -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  360:     Cmd1 = Erl ++ " -mode interactive -noshell -eval " ++ Eval1,
  361:     "interactiveembedded" = os:cmd(Cmd1),
  362: 
  363:     Eval2 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of embedded -> init:restart([{mode,interactive}]); interactive -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  364:     Cmd2 = Erl ++ " -mode embedded -noshell -eval " ++ Eval2,
  365:     "embeddedinteractive" = os:cmd(Cmd2),
  366: 
  367:     ok.
  368: 
  369: %% ------------------------------------------------
  370: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  371: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  372: %% before restart.
  373: %% ------------------------------------------------
  374: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     Args = args(),
  376:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args, connection => standard_io}),
  377:     %% Ok, the node is up, now the real test test begins.
  378:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  379:     SysProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  380:     io:format("SysProcs0=~p~n", [SysProcs0]),
  381:     [InitPid, PurgerPid, LitCollectorPid,
  382:      DirtySigNPid, DirtySigHPid, DirtySigMPid,
  383:      PrimFilePid,
  384:      TraceCleanerPid,
  385:      ESockRegPid] = SysProcs0,
  386:     InitPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  387:     PurgerPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  388:     Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  389:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  390:     MaxPid = lists:last(Procs),
  391:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  392:     receive
  393: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  394: 	    ok
  395:     after 10000 ->
  396: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  397: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  398:     end,
  399:     ok = wait_restart(30, Node),
  400: 
  401:     SysProcs1 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  402:     io:format("SysProcs1=~p~n", [SysProcs1]),
  403:     [InitPid1, PurgerPid1, LitCollectorPid1,
  404:      DirtySigNPid1, DirtySigHPid1, DirtySigMPid1,
  405:      PrimFilePid1,
  406:      TraceCleanerPid1,
  407:      ESockRegPid1] = SysProcs1,
  408: 
  409:     %% Still the same init process!
  410:     InitPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  411:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid),
  412:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid1),
  413: 
  414:     %% and same purger process!
  415:     PurgerPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  416:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid),
  417:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid1),
  418: 
  419:     %% and same literal area collector process!
  420:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid),
  421:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid1),
  422: 
  423:     %% and same normal dirty signal handler process!
  424:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid),
  425:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid1),
  426:     %% and same high dirty signal handler process!
  427:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid),
  428:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid1),
  429:     %% and same max dirty signal handler process!
  430:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid),
  431:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid1),
  432: 
  433:     %% and same prim_file helper process!
  434:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid),
  435:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid1),
  436: 
  437:     %% and same trace_cleaner process!
  438:     TraceCleanerP = pid_to_list(TraceCleanerPid),
  439:     TraceCleanerP = pid_to_list(TraceCleanerPid1),
  440: 
  441:     %% and same socket_registry helper process!
  442:     if ESockRegPid =:= undefined, ESockRegPid1 =:= undefined ->
  443:             %% No socket registry on either node
  444:             ok;
  445:        true ->
  446:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid),
  447:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid1)
  448:     end,
  449: 
  450:     NewProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  451:     NewProcs = NewProcs0 -- SysProcs1,
  452:     case check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) of
  453: 	true ->
  454: 	    ok;
  455: 	_ ->
  456: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  457: 	    ct:fail(processes_not_greater)
  458:     end,
  459: 
  460:     %% Check that socket tables has been re-initialized; check one
  461:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  462: 
  463:     %% Test that, for instance, the same argument still exists.
  464:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  465: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  466: 	    ok;
  467: 	_ ->
  468: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  469: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, restart_fail})
  470:     end,
  471:     peer:stop(Peer),
  472:     ok.
  473: 
  474: -record(sys_procs, {init,
  475: 		    code_purger,
  476: 		    literal_collector,
  477: 		    dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  478: 		    dirty_sig_handler_high,
  479: 		    dirty_sig_handler_max,
  480:                     prim_file,
  481:                     trace_cleaner,
  482:                     socket_registry}).
  483: 
  484: find_system_processes() ->
  485:     find_system_procs(processes(), #sys_procs{}).
  486: 
  487: find_system_procs([], SysProcs) ->
  488:     [SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  489:      SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  490:      SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  491:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  492:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  493:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  494:      SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  495:      SysProcs#sys_procs.trace_cleaner,
  496:      SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry];
  497: find_system_procs([P|Ps], SysProcs) ->
  498:     case process_info(P, [initial_call, priority]) of
  499: 	[{initial_call,{erl_init,start,2}},_] ->
  500: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  501: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{init = P});
  502: 	[{initial_call,{erts_code_purger,start,0}},_] ->
  503: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  504: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{code_purger = P});
  505: 	[{initial_call,{erts_literal_area_collector,start,0}},_] ->
  506: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  507: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{literal_collector = P});
  508: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  509:          {priority,normal}] ->
  510: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  511: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_normal = P});
  512: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  513:                        {priority,high}] ->
  514: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  515: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_high = P});
  516: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  517:          {priority,max}] ->
  518: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  519: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_max = P});
  520:         [{initial_call,{prim_file,start,0}},_] ->
  521: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  522: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{prim_file = P});
  523:         [{initial_call,{erts_trace_cleaner,start,0}}, _] ->
  524: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.trace_cleaner,
  525: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{trace_cleaner = P});
  526:         [{initial_call,{socket_registry,start,0}},_] ->
  527: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry,
  528: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{socket_registry = P});
  529: 	_ ->
  530: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs)
  531:     end.
  532: 
  533: wait_restart(0, _Node) ->
  534:     ct:fail(not_restarted);
  535: wait_restart(N, Node) ->
  536:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  537: 	pong -> ok;
  538: 	_ -> 
  539: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
  540: 	    wait_restart(N - 1, Node)
  541:     end.
  542: 
  543: check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) ->
  544:     [N,P,I] = apid(MaxPid),
  545:     case lists:filter(fun(Pid) ->
  546: 			      case apid(Pid) of
  547: 				  [N,P1,_I1] when P1 > P -> false;
  548: 				  [N,_P1,I1] when I1 > I -> false;
  549: 				  _                      -> true
  550: 			      end
  551: 		      end, NewProcs) of
  552: 	[] ->
  553: 	    true;
  554: 	_  ->
  555: 	    false
  556:     end.
  557: 
  558: apid(Pid) ->
  559:     [N,P,I] = string:tokens(pid_to_list(Pid),"<>."),
  560:     [list_to_integer(N),list_to_integer(P),list_to_integer(I)].
  561: 
  562: fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node) ->
  563:     case code:is_loaded(prim_socket) of
  564:         {file,preloaded} ->
  565:             lists:sort(rpc:call(Node, socket, supports, [msg_flags]));
  566:         _ ->
  567:             ok
  568:     end.
  569: 
  570: %% ------------------------------------------------
  571: %% Just test that the system is halted here.
  572: %% The reboot facility using heart is tested
  573: %% in the heart_SUITE.
  574: %% ------------------------------------------------
  575: reboot(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  576:     Args = args(),
  577:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  578:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  579:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  580:     receive
  581: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  582: 	    ok
  583:     after 10000 ->
  584: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  585: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  586:     end,
  587:     ct:sleep(5000),
  588:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  589: 	pang ->
  590: 	    ok;
  591: 	_ ->
  592: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  593: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  594:     end,
  595:     ok.
  596: 
  597: %% ------------------------------------------------
  598: %%
  599: %% ------------------------------------------------
  600: stop_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  601:     badarg = catch_stop([65,[66],67]),  % flat strings only
  602:     badarg = catch_stop([65, 666, 67]),  % only bytes in string
  603:     badarg = catch_stop(abort),  % 'abort' not allowed
  604:     badarg = catch_stop(true),  % other atoms not allowed
  605:     badarg = catch_stop(-1),  % no negative statuses
  606:     ok.
  607: 
  608: catch_stop(Status) ->
  609:     try init:stop(Status) catch error:badarg -> badarg end.
  610: 
  611: %% ------------------------------------------------
  612: %%
  613: %% ------------------------------------------------
  614: stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  615:     Args = args(),
  616:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  617:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  618:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  619:     receive
  620: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  621: 	    ok
  622:     after 10000 ->
  623: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  624: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  625:     end,
  626:     ct:sleep(5000),
  627:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  628: 	pang ->
  629: 	    ok;
  630: 	_ ->
  631: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  632: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  633:     end,
  634:     ok.
  635: 
  636: %% ------------------------------------------------
  637: %% 
  638: %% ------------------------------------------------
  639: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  640:     {Start, _} = init:get_status(),
  641: 
  642:     %% Depending on how the test_server is started Start has
  643:     %% different values. staring if test_server started with
  644:     %% -s flag.
  645:     case lists:member(Start, [started, starting]) of
  646: 	true ->
  647: 	    ok;
  648: 	_ ->
  649: 	    ct:fail(get_status)
  650:     end.
  651: 
  652: %% ------------------------------------------------
  653: %% 
  654: %% ------------------------------------------------
  655: script_id(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  656:     {Name, Vsn} = init:script_id(),
  657:     if
  658: 	is_list(Name), is_list(Vsn) ->
  659: 	    ok;
  660: 	true ->
  661: 	    ct:fail(not_standard_script)
  662:     end,
  663:     ok.
  664: 
  665: %% ------------------------------------------------
  666: %% Test that .erlang file works as it should
  667: %% ------------------------------------------------
  668: dot_erlang(Config) ->
  669:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  670: 
  671:     TestHome = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  672:     ok = file:make_dir(TestHome),
  673: 
  674:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  675:                   {win32, _} ->
  676:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  677:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  678:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  679:                   _ ->
  680:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  681:               end,
  682: 
  683:     NodeOpts = #{ env => HomeEnv },
  684: 
  685:     %% Get basedir of peer node
  686:     {ok, CreatorPeer, CreatorNode} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  687:     UserConfig = erpc:call(CreatorNode, filename, basedir, [user_config,"erlang"]),
  688:     peer:stop(CreatorPeer),
  689: 
  690:     XDGErlang = filename:join([UserConfig, ".erlang"]),
  691:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(XDGErlang),
  692:     ok = file:write_file(XDGErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,xdg)."),
  693: 
  694:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  695: 
  696:     ?assertEqual({ok, xdg}, erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  697:     peer:stop(Peer),
  698: 
  699:     HomeErlang = filename:join([TestHome, ".erlang"]),
  700:     ok = file:write_file(HomeErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,home)."),
  701:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  702: 
  703:     ?assertEqual({ok, home}, erpc:call(Node2, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  704:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  705: 
  706:     ok.
  707: 
  708: unknown_module(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  709:     Port = open_port({spawn, "erl -s unknown_module"},
  710:                      [exit_status, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  711:     Error = "Error! Failed to load module 'unknown_module' because it cannot be found.",
  712:     [_ | _] = string:find(collect_until_exit_one(Port), Error),
  713:     ok.
  714: 
  715: collect_until_exit_one(Port) ->
  716:     receive
  717:         {Port, {data, Msg}} -> Msg ++ collect_until_exit_one(Port);
  718:         {Port, {exit_status, 1}} -> []
  719:     after
  720:         30_000 -> ct:fail(erl_timeout)
  721:     end.
  722: 
  723: %% ------------------------------------------------
  724: %% Start the slave system with -boot flag.
  725: %% ------------------------------------------------
  726: 
  727: boot1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  728:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", "start_sasl"],
  729:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  730:     peer:stop(Peer),
  731: 
  732:     %% Try to start with non existing boot file.
  733:     Args1 = args() ++ ["-boot", "dummy_script"],
  734:     try
  735:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args1, connection => standard_io}),
  736:         ct:fail({boot1, "started with non existing boot file"})
  737:     catch
  738:         exit:{boot_failed, {exit_status, 1}} ->
  739:             ok
  740:     end.
  741: 
  742: boot2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  743:     %% Absolute boot file name
  744:     Boot = filename:join([code:root_dir(), "bin", "start_sasl"]),
  745: 
  746:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", Boot],
  747:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  748:     peer:stop(Peer),
  749: 
  750:     case os:type() of 
  751: 	{win32, _} ->
  752: 	    %% Absolute boot file name for Windows -- all slashes are
  753: 	    %% converted to backslashes.
  754: 	    Win_boot = lists:map(fun
  755: 				     ($/) -> $\\;
  756: 				     (C) -> C
  757: 				end, Boot),
  758: 	    Args2 = args() ++ ["-boot", Win_boot],
  759: 	    {ok, Peer2, _Node2} = ?CT_PEER(Args2),
  760: 	    peer:stop(Peer2);
  761: 	_ ->
  762: 	    ok
  763:     end,
  764: 
  765:     ok.
  766: 
  767: dash_S(_Config) ->
  768: 
  769:     %% Test that arguments are passed correctly
  770:     {[],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test([]),
  771:     {["a"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["a"]),
  772:     {["-S","--"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-S","--"]),
  773:     {["--help"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["--help"]),
  774:     {["-extra"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-extra"]),
  775:     {["-run"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-run"]),
  776:     {["-args_file"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-args_file"]),
  777:     {["+A","-1"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["+A","-1"]),
  778:     {["-s","init","stop"],[],[]} = run_dash_S_test(["-s","init","stop"]),
  779: 
  780:     %% Test that environment variables are handled correctly
  781:     {["a"],["b","c","d"],[]} =
  782:         run_dash_S_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","b"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],["a"]),
  783:     %% test that -S in environment variables are interpreted as flags
  784:     {["a"],[],[["a"],["b"],["c"]]} =
  785:         run_dash_S_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","+S 1 -S a"},{"ERL_FLAGS","-S b"},
  786:                          {"ERL_ZFLAGS","-S c"}],["a"]),
  787: 
  788:     %% Test that -s and -run work
  789:     ?assertMatch(
  790:        "[a].{[\"a\""++_,
  791:        run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_s","a","-S",?MODULE,"test_dash_S","a"])),
  792:     ?assertMatch(
  793:        "[\"a\"].{[\"a\""++_,
  794:        run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_s","a","-S",?MODULE,"test_dash_S","a"])),
  795: 
  796:     %% Test error conditions
  797:     ?assertNotEqual(
  798:        nomatch,
  799:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S"]),
  800:                    "Error! The -S option must be followed by at least a module to start")),
  801: 
  802:     ?assertNotEqual(
  803:        nomatch,
  804:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S","a"]),
  805:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  806: 
  807:     ?assertNotEqual(
  808:        nomatch,
  809:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-S",?MODULE,"a"]),
  810:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/1 is not exported.")),
  811: 
  812:     ok.
  813: 
  814: run_dash_S_test(Args) ->
  815:     run_dash_S_test("", Args).
  816: run_dash_S_test(Prefix, Args) ->
  817:     run_dash_test(Prefix, ["-S", ?MODULE, "test_dash_S" | Args]).
  818: 
  819: test_dash_S(Args) ->
  820:     AllArgs = {Args, init:get_plain_arguments(),
  821:                proplists:get_all_values('S',init:get_arguments()),
  822:                erlang:system_info(emu_args)},
  823:     io:format("~p.",[AllArgs]),
  824:     erlang:halt().
  825: 
  826: test_dash_s(Args) ->
  827:     io:format("~p.",[Args]).
  828: 
  829: dash_run(_Config) ->
  830: 
  831:     {undefined,[]} =
  832:         run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","-s","init","stop"]),
  833: 
  834:     {["a"],["b"]} =
  835:         run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","a","--","b","-s","init","stop"]),
  836: 
  837:     %% Test error conditions
  838:     ?assertNotEqual(
  839:        nomatch,
  840:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run","a"]),
  841:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  842: 
  843:     ?assertNotEqual(
  844:        nomatch,
  845:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE]),
  846:                    "Error! init_SUITE:start/0 is not exported.")),
  847: 
  848:     ?assertNotEqual(
  849:        nomatch,
  850:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-run",?MODULE,"a"]),
  851:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/0 is not exported.")),
  852: 
  853:     ok.
  854: 
  855: test_dash_run() ->
  856:     test_dash_run(undefined).
  857: test_dash_run(Args) ->
  858:     io:format("~p.",[{Args, init:get_plain_arguments(), erlang:system_info(emu_args)}]),
  859:     ok.
  860: 
  861: dash_s(_Config) ->
  862: 
  863:     {undefined,[]} =
  864:         run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","-s","init","stop"]),
  865: 
  866:     {[a],["b"]} =
  867:         run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"test_dash_run","a","--","b","-s","init","stop"]),
  868: 
  869:     %% Test error conditions
  870:     ?assertNotEqual(
  871:        nomatch,
  872:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s","a"]),
  873:                    "Error! Failed to load module 'a' because it cannot be found.")),
  874: 
  875:     ?assertNotEqual(
  876:        nomatch,
  877:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE]),
  878:                    "Error! init_SUITE:start/0 is not exported.")),
  879: 
  880:     ?assertNotEqual(
  881:        nomatch,
  882:        string:find(run_dash_test(["-s",?MODULE,"a"]),
  883:                    "Error! init_SUITE:a/0 is not exported.")),
  884: 
  885:     ok.
  886: 
  887: dash_extra(Config) ->
  888:     %% Test that arguments are passed correctly
  889:     {[]} = run_dash_extra_test([]),
  890:     {["a"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["a"]),
  891:     {["--help"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["--help"]),
  892:     {["-S","--"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-S","--"]),
  893:     {["-extra","--"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-extra","--"]),
  894:     {["-run"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-run"]),
  895:     {["-args_file"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-args_file"]),
  896:     {["+A","-1"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["+A","-1"]),
  897:     {["-s","init","stop"]} = run_dash_extra_test(["-s","init","stop"]),
  898: 
  899:     %% Test that environment variables are handled correctly
  900:     {["b","c","d","a"]} =
  901:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","b"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],
  902:                             ["a"]),
  903:     {["c","d","+A","1","--","a"]} =
  904:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","-extra +A 1 --"},{"ERL_FLAGS","c"},{"ERL_ZFLAGS","d"}],
  905:                             ["a"]),
  906:     {["+A","a","+B","+C"]} =
  907:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_AFLAGS","-extra +A"},
  908:                              {"ERL_FLAGS","-extra +B"},
  909:                              {"ERL_ZFLAGS","-extra +C"}],["a"]),
  910: 
  911:     %% Test that arguments from -args_file work as they should
  912:     ArgsFile = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config),
  913:                              atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_args_file.args"),
  914:     NestedArgsFile = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config),
  915:                              atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_nexted_args_file.args"),
  916:     file:write_file(NestedArgsFile,"y -extra +Y"),
  917: 
  918:     file:write_file(ArgsFile,["z -args_file ",NestedArgsFile," -extra +Z"]),
  919: 
  920:     {["c","z","y","d",
  921:       %% -extra starts here
  922:       "a","+Y","+Z","b"]} =
  923:         run_dash_extra_test([{"ERL_FLAGS",["c -args_file ",ArgsFile," d -extra b"]}],["a"]),
  924: 
  925:     ok.
  926: 
  927: run_dash_extra_test(Args) ->
  928:     run_dash_extra_test([], Args).
  929: run_dash_extra_test(Prefix, Args) ->
  930:     run_dash_test(Prefix, ["-run", ?MODULE, "test_dash_extra", "-extra" | Args]).
  931: 
  932: test_dash_extra() ->
  933:     AllArgs = {init:get_plain_arguments(), erlang:system_info(emu_args)},
  934:     io:format("~p.",[AllArgs]),
  935:     erlang:halt().
  936: 
  937: 
  938: run_dash_test(Args) ->
  939:     run_dash_test([],Args).
  940: run_dash_test(Env, Args) ->
  941:     [Exec | ExecArgs] = string:split(ct:get_progname()," ", all),
  942:     PortExec = os:find_executable(Exec),
  943:     PortArgs = ExecArgs ++ ["-pa",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  944:                             "-noshell" | Args],
  945:     PortEnv = [{"ERL_CRASH_DUMP_SECONDS","0"} |
  946:                [{K,lists:flatten(V)} || {K, V} <- Env]],
  947:     ct:log("Exec: ~p~nPortArgs: ~p~nPortEnv: ~p~n",[PortExec, PortArgs, PortEnv]),
  948:     Port =
  949:         open_port({spawn_executable, PortExec},
  950:                   [stderr_to_stdout,binary,out,in,hide,exit_status,
  951:                    {args, PortArgs}, {env, PortEnv}]),
  952:     receive
  953:         {Port,{exit_status,N}} ->
  954:             N
  955:     after 5000 ->
  956:             ct:fail({timeout, receive M -> M after 0 -> [] end})
  957:     end,
  958:     Res = unicode:characters_to_list(
  959:             iolist_to_binary(
  960:               (fun F() ->
  961:                        receive
  962:                            {Port,{data,Data}} ->
  963:                                [Data | F()]
  964:                        after 0 ->
  965:                                []
  966:                        end
  967:                end)())),
  968:     ct:log("Res: ~ts~n",[Res]),
  969:     maybe
  970:         {ok, Toks, _} ?= erl_scan:string(Res),
  971:         {ok, Tuple} ?= erl_parse:parse_term(Toks),
  972:         erlang:delete_element(tuple_size(Tuple), Tuple)
  973:     else
  974:         _ ->
  975:             Res
  976:     end.
  977: 
  978: %% Misc. functions    
  979: 
  980: args() ->
  981:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp",
  982:         "--", "c", "d", "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  983: 
  984: long_args(A) ->
  985:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp", "--", "c", A,
  986:         "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  987: 
  988: create_script(Config) ->
  989:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  990:     Name = PrivDir ++ "boot_var_test",
  991:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
  992:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
  993:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
  994:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
  995:     io:format(Fd,
  996: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
  997: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
  998: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
  999: 	      [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
 1000:     file:close(Fd),
 1001:     {filename:dirname(Name), filename:basename(Name),
 1002:      KernelVer, StdlibVer}.
 1003:
